course_title: Freshmen Seminar in MESAS: Religion & Politics
class_notes:
Instructor: Courtney Freer


This course will provide students an overview of the religions of the Middle East and the relationship between religion and politics in the region. To that end, it will involve thematic discussions of the interplay between religion and political structures and participation, in addition to using five country case studies (Egypt, Iran, Israel, Saudi Arabia, and Turkey) to illustrate this relationship.
course_description: Exclusively for first-year students. Seminar provides introduction to various historical, religious, cultural, and linguistic aspects of the Middle East and South Asia. Topics vary.
sections: Class Nbr: 5994, Section #: 4, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 8:30-9:45a, Instructor: C. Freer, Status: Open
